APBD DKI, Anggaran Ballpoint Rp 123 M Diganti ATK Rp 18 M
01 Nov 2019, 12:17 by Imam Hamdi, Febriyan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Kepala Suku Dinas Pendidikan Jakarta Timur mengklarifikasi soal anggaran ballpoint sebesar Rp 123 miliar dalam APBD DKI 2020 yang sempat menghebohkan. Menurut dia, anggaran itu kini telah direvisi menjadi Rp 18 miliar, itu pun untuk seluruh kebutuhan alat tulis dan kantor, bukan hanya ballpoint saja.
Ade mengaku tak tahu menahu soal siapa yang memasukkan usulan anggaran tersebut. Pasalnya, dia baru menjabat sebagai Kepala Sudain Pendidikan Jakarta Timur selama sebulan.
"Saya tidak tahu kalau ada anggaran itu. Setahu saya tidak ada," ujarnya saat dihubungi.
Ade mengatakan anggaran pembelian ATK untuk sekitar 300 lebih sekolah negeri di Jaktim telah direvisi. Kini, kata dia, Sudin Pendidikan Jakarta Timur hanya mengusulkan anggaran pembelian ATK senilai Rp 18 miliar.
"Tapi detailnya saya tidak hafal. Kalau mau datanya di kantor. Sekarang saya lagi ada rapat di sekolah," kata Ade
Anggaran Rp 123 miliar untuk pengadaan ballpoin itu diungkap oleh Anggota DPRD DKI Fraksi PSI, William Aditya Sarana. Melalui cuitannya, William mempertanyakan anggaran untuk Sudin Jakarta Timur itu karena dinilai terlalu besar. William juga menyoroti berbagai anggaran janggal lainnya dalam APBD DKI Jakarta seperti anggaran pembelian lem aibon sebesar Rp 82 miliar yang akhirnya dihapus.

DKI APBD, Ballpoint Budget Rp. 123 Billion, Replace ATK Rp. 18 Billion
Nov 01 2019, 12:17 by Imam Hamdi, Febriyan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Head of the East Jakarta Education Office clarified the question of a ballpoint budget of Rp. 123 billion in the DKI 2020 APBD which was horrendous. According to him, the budget has now been revised to Rp 18 billion, even for all stationery and office needs, not just ballpoints.
Ade claimed not to know anything about who submitted the budget proposal. The reason is, he only served as Head of East Jakarta Education Sudain for a month.
"I don't know if there is a budget. As far as I know there isn't," he said when contacted.
Ade said the budget for purchasing ATK for around 300 more public schools in East Jakarta had been revised. Now, he said, the East Jakarta Education Sub-Department only proposed a budget for buying ATKs worth Rp 18 billion.
"But the details I don't memorize. If you want the data in the office. Now I have a meeting at school," said Ade
The budget of Rp. 123 billion for the procurement of the ballpoint was revealed by DKI DPRD Faction DPRD Member William Aditya Sarana. Through his tweet, William questioned the budget for East Jakarta Sub-dept. Because it was considered too large. William also highlighted a variety of other odd budgets in the DKI Jakarta APBD such as the budget for buying aibon glue of Rp. 82 billion, which was eventually removed.
